person.persName: Thomas Paine Porter (Woodford County, Kentucky, attorney, state Rep, state Senator,, and acting Lieutenant Governor)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, attorney, politician, and acting Lieutenant Governor. Madison County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles C. Porter. Graduate of Transylvania University Law School in 1842. Admitted to the bar in 1845. Married to America McAfee Porter in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on March 11, 1846. Father of America Porter. Married to Susan V. Hancock Porter in Woodford County, Kentucky, on March 16, 1848. Father of Jessamine Porter. Attorney in Woodford County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Woodford County from 1853 to 1855. Member of the Democratic party. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Woodford County from 1857 to 1861. Attorney in Woodford County in 1860. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Speaker of the Senate and acting Lieutenant Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1859 to 1861.
